snippet: In the first half of this year alone, as more than 179,000 people applied for asylum, Germany’s Interior Ministry recorded 202 attacks on housing for them.
abstract: Rights activists are raising concerns about uptick in Germany of far-right protests, arson and violence against migrants, particularly targeting Roma or asylum seekers from Europe's poorest countries; Germany is dealing with largest influx in Europe, and observers say rate of anti-immigrant crimes there has outpaced the rest of the Continent; asylum applications have risen by 132 percent over past year, and some 202 attacks have been recorded in same period on housing for asylum seekers.
lead_paragraph: In the first half of this year alone, as more than 179,000 people applied for asylum, Germany’s Interior Ministry recorded 202 attacks on housing for them.

headline.main: Violent Backlash Against Migrants in Germany as Asylum-Seekers Pour In
headline.print_headline: Violence Against Newcomers Raises Concerns About German Far Right

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
